about.title: About
description: I am a Computer Science undergraduate at National University of Singapore. My areas of focus are Programming Languages and Artifical Intelligence.
I am also a coreteam member (and President) of NUS Hackers.
I am a scholar under the University Scholars Programme at NUS. You can find my sociolinguistics research papers and essays written during my studies at USP here.
You can contact me at suyash@nushackers.org for matters pertaining to NUS Hackers. Otherwise you can drop me an email at suyashshekhar@gmail.com.
You could also reach out to me on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook or find me on Github.

books.title: Books
books.description: If I ever had a library of books just for myself, these are some of the books which would definitely be on the shelves. I haven't read all of them but I hope to be able to someday:

list.title: The Art of Charlie Chan Hock Chye
The Subtle Art of Not Giving A F*ck
Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
Brief Answers to the Big Questions
Homo Deus: A Brief History of Tomorrow
GÃ¶del, Escher, Bach: an Eternal Golden Braid
The Presentation of Self in Everyday Life
Learn You a Haskell for Great Good!

blog.title: Blog
blog.description: I personally find it hard to maintain a blog. Yet, I have been trying to get one up soon. Work in progress.

movies.title: Movies
movies.description: I love watching movies (who doesn't :p). And yet, I know that there are many good ones out there that I have yet to watch. I have watched most of the movies on this list but I go back to them often to refresh my memory:

articles.title: Articles
articles.description: Every now and then I come across an article which I want to share with others. Here is a list of some of those:

list.title: Kaleidoscope: Implementing a Language with LLVM
Notes to CS freshmen from the future
Functors, Applicatives, And Monads In Pictures

resume.title: Resume
resume.description: You can download it here or view it below (it may take a while to load..)

videos.title: Videos
videos.description: Haven't videos become the most common mode of content consumption already? Here is a list of some good ones:

list.title: Tim Urban: Inside the mind of a master procrastinator
Randy Pausch: Last Lecture - Achieving Your Childhood Dreams
Alex Honnold: How I climbed a 3,000-foot vertical cliff without ropes

work.title: Work
work.description: I have interned at a few companies in Singapore before. Here is a brief summary of that:

list.title: Sea(Garena)
list.desc: I interned with the iOS team at Sea during the summer of 2018 at Sea to build a internal debugging/error reporting tool.

list.title: Tinkerbox
list.desc: I interned with Tinkerbox during the summer of 2017 where I mostly worked with Ruby on Rails.

list.title: NUS School of Computing
list.desc: I worked as a Teaching Assistant under the NUS School of Computing. I taught CS2010: Data Structures and Algorithms II and CS2103: Software Engineering.

teaching.title: Teaching
teaching.description: Here are some classes that I taught at NUS Computing:

list.title: CS2010 (Spring, 2018)
list.desc: I worked as a tutor for CS2010 which is the second algorithms class taught at NUS Computing. I made my own notes/slides for all my classes. You can find them here.

list.title: CS2103 (Fall, 2018)
list.desc: CS2103 is the largest Software Engineering class compulsory for all Computer Science undergraduates. It teaches the basics of software design, UML Diagrams, Design Patters and other important Software Engineering principles.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Here is a list of projects that I actively work on have worked on in the past:

list.title: Lumos
list.desc: A light Swift wrapper around Objective-C Runtime.

list.title: Showface
list.desc: A web app written using React and GraphQL to navigate schedules to find the best time to meet.

list.title: Paybob
list.desc: A telegram bot to manage money easier.

list.title: Satisfiability Checker
list.desc: An implementation of the Davis-Putnam algorithm and the DavisâLogemannâLoveland (DLL) algorithm in Prolog.

list.title: Tetris AI
list.desc: A Tetris AI program written in Java which uses Simulated Annealing & Genetic Algorithm.

list.title: NusLib
list.desc: An is an iOS app to allow students to borrow and browse through books from the various libraries in NUS. Based on your borrowing history, it can also suggest related works. Other features include finding books by ISBN and barcode and an internal book review system.

list.title: Sorting Hat
list.desc: This is a project that I worked on together with my friend Varun. We devised an algorithm using z3 and pandas to optimise room allocation based on students' room and floor preferences.

list.title: Twitter Clone
list.desc: This was my first attempt at Ruby on Rails back in 2017.

list.title: Bojio
list.desc: An Android app to allow people to share their calendars and be able to find a common timeslot to meet-up. My friends and I made this during our first hackathon, Hack&Roll 2017.
